instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
hello guys 
macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board no <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only orange light appears , found some corrosion near <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> pin 1&2

DCPS stuck on 015mAmp
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.42 IS PRESENT
ANY SUGGESTION

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery connected).
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

Be aware, this board requires 85W Magsafe 2 charger to turn on; if no good battery present.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Is important to know...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Are you using 85W Magsafe 2 charger?
Be aware, this board doesn't turn on with 45/60W charger, if no good battery is connected.

Check <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> and the 4 PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
yes have 85W Magsafe Charger but right now using DCPS at 18.10V-3.5Amp for testing

3.42V  is present  on <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
"DCPS at 18.10V-3.5Amp for testing"
It is connected with 85W Magsafe 2 cable???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: What about the other mentioned signals???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>   3.1v IS PRESENT
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>   NO VOLT ON THIS LINE
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>    3.39V  AVAILABLE

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>   NO VOLT ON THIS LINE"
PCH will not start Power On Sequence, until gets high level there.
This signal usually goes low using 45/60W charger, instead of correct 85W.
Check your power cable, if is recognized at 85W in other working Mac.

Just in case, try connecting both charger and known good battery at same time.
See if starts pressing power button.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
i have one question 
if we are using DCPS at 18.10-3.3Amp,for this also we need 85W magsafe cable?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do you mean that you've connected just positive and negative from lab PSU???
How the SMC will recognize the power then???
It MUST talk with the 1-wire memory from the Magsafe connector, where the information is stored...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: i am using magsafe 2 cable, sharing an image for reference

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Is that recognized as 85W in other machine?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
i does't had 85W charger & the charger which i got from customer was repaired, replaced magsafe 2 cable by 60W.... but i have a 85W magsafe 1 charger & from your reference i adjust this cable in this MAC 
finally fan spins:)
the best thing i have learned in this case, the importance of Same watt charger.

thanks dear

threads.message:

stuck on 0.005mAmp (no green or orange light)

L7095   3V42  is present
3v42 is also present on 4 RTC

<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>     NO VOLT ON THIS LINE
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>               NO VOLT ON THIS LINE 
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>    no volt on this line

3V42 is present on      <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>  
 no volt on this line     <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Please open new thread with diferent repair job.

BTW, get original Magsafe 2; stop using 1->2 adapters...
